page.title: 12CHEDWORTH ROMAN VILLA -PAST
page.content: The best known feature in the area is the{Roman Villa.}Started about A.D. 120, after much rebuilding it was abandoned in the late 4th. century.The latest coins have been dated A.D. 383. Although Chedworth is the most clearly visible, there are 26 other villas near by with 6 or 7 within 4 kms. In common it occupies a sheltered site, near a water supply and around the 150-200 metre contour height. The{ Salt Way }from Droitwich to Cirencester passed close to the site and a short easy journey by track to the Fosse Way led to the large Roman settlement of Corinium _ Cirencester _ for trade, business and pleasure. First excavated in 1864/1865 sheds were built over the remains to protect them. Less wise was the house that now prevents full appreciation of the{villa's secluded location.
